medical_history.chief_complaint: Exertional dyspnea and bilateral pulmonary nodules.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient began to experience exertional dyspnea 16 months before admission, which gradually worsened. Four months prior to admission, a productive cough developed, which included blood-streaked sputum following severe coughing. Symptoms remained unchanged at the time of admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Retinitis pigmentosa diagnosed at age three, resulting in legal blindness. No other relevant medical history specified.
medical_history.family_history: A sister died of a brain tumor at the age of 39 years.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was physically active, lost 18 kg over four years, smoked briefly in her teens, and did not drink alcohol. No other social history specified.
